<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BI-&gt;getSuccessor(0) != BI-&gt;getSuccessor(1))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note: we may end up here because the original IR had such branches.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder&lt;&gt;</a> Builder(BB);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Replaces the target of branch instruction in |BB| with |NewTarget| if it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// was |OldTarget|. This function also fixes the associated merge instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Splits the given edges by recreating proxy nodes so that the destination</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// has unique incoming edges from this region.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// clang-format off</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In SPIR-V, constructs must have a single exit/merge.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Given nodes A and B in the construct, a node C outside, and the following edges.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  A -&gt; C</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  B -&gt; C</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In such cases, we must create a new exit node D, that belong to the construct to make is viable:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A -&gt; D -&gt; C</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// B -&gt; D -&gt; C</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is fine (assuming C has no PHI nodes), but requires handling the merge instruction here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// By adding a proxy node, we create a regular divergent shape which can easily be regularized later on.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A -&gt; D -&gt; D1 -&gt; C</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// B -&gt; D -&gt; D2 -&gt; C</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A, B, D belongs to the construct. D is the exit. D1 and D2 are empty.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1127"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1128"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1129" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spirvstructurizer/#ae28745bde66751075de0a88c63c3e24e"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spirvstructurizer/#ae28745bde66751075de0a88c63c3e24e">ID</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1130"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1131" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spirvstructurizer/#a20865863fd3df100ca001e32a0974a05"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spirvstructurizer/#a20865863fd3df100ca001e32a0974a05">SPIRVStructurizer</a>() : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functionpass/#a7691d83e3561f781cae4ce4a01bdfa93">FunctionPass</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spirvstructurizer/#ae28745bde66751075de0a88c63c3e24e">ID</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1132"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abb0ce1887c5b0d934a3f8dee52ee2904">initializeSPIRVStructurizerPass</a>(&#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/passregistry/#a05a729900b76c89e808c6c3094921b2f">PassRegistry::getPassRegistry</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1133"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1134"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1135" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spirvstructurizer/#aa67ff3b67e1d9aa42109d878ebe23e5a"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spirvstructurizer/#aa67ff3b67e1d9aa42109d878ebe23e5a">runOnFunction</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> override </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1136"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1137"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1138"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In LLVM, Switches are allowed to have several cases branching to the same</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1139"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// basic block. This is allowed in SPIR-V, but can make structurizing SPIR-V</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1140"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// harder, so first remove edge cases.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1141"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= splitSwitchCases(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1142"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1143"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// LLVM allows conditional branches to have both side jumping to the same</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1144"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// block. It also allows switched to have a single default, or just one</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1145"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// case. Cleaning this up now.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1146"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= simplifyBranches(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1147"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1148"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// At this state, we should have a reducible CFG with cycles.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1149"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// STEP 1: Adding OpLoopMerge instructions to loop headers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1150"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= addMergeForLoops(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1151"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1152"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// STEP 2: adding OpSelectionMerge to each node with an in-degree &gt;= 2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1153"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= addMergeForNodesWithMultiplePredecessors(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1154"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1155"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// STEP 3:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1156"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Sort selection merge, the largest construct goes first.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1157"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This simplifies the next step.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1158"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= sortSelectionMergeHeaders(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1159"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1160"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// STEP 4: As this stage, we can have a single basic block with multiple</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1161"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// OpLoopMerge/OpSelectionMerge instructions. Splitting this block so each</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1162"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// BB has a single merge instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1163"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= splitBlocksWithMultipleHeaders(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1164"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1165"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// STEP 5: In the previous steps, we added merge blocks the loops and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1166"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// natural merge blocks (in-degree &gt;= 2). What remains are conditions with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1167"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// an exiting branch (return, unreachable). In such case, we must start from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1168"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the header, and add headers to divergent construct with no headers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1169"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= addMergeForDivergentBlocks(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1170"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1171"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// STEP 6: At this stage, we have several divergent construct defines by a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1172"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// header and a merge block. But their boundaries have no constraints: a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1173"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// construct exit could be outside of the parents&#39; construct exit. Such</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1174"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// edges are called critical edges. What we need is to split those edges</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1175"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into several parts. Each part exiting the parent&#39;s construct by its merge</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1176"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1177"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= splitCriticalEdges(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1178"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1179"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// STEP 7: The previous steps possibly created a lot of &quot;proxy&quot; blocks.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1180"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Blocks with a single unconditional branch, used to create a valid</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1181"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// divergent construct tree. Some nodes are still requires (e.g: nodes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1182"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// allowing a valid exit through the parent&#39;s merge block). But some are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1183"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// left-overs of past transformations, and could cause actual validation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1184"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// issues. E.g: the SPIR-V spec allows a construct to break to the parents</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1185"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loop construct without an OpSelectionMerge, but this requires a straight</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1186"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// jump. If a proxy block lies between the conditional branch and the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1187"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// parent&#39;s merge, the CFG is not valid.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1188"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= removeUselessBlocks(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1189"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1190"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// STEP 8: Final fix-up steps: our tree boundaries are correct, but some</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1191"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// blocks are branching with no header. Those are often simple conditional</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1192"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// branches with 1 or 2 returning edges. Adding a header for those.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1193"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= addHeaderToRemainingDivergentDAG(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1194"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1195"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// STEP 9: sort basic blocks to match both the LLVM &amp; SPIR-V requirements.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1196"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a> |= <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3e4870aac193f722693ae7e24aa5a2be">sortBlocks</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1197"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1198"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopdeletion-cpp/#a0f1c83c3d08d80b12c424962a5e94ce8a35e0c8c0b180c95d4e122e55ed62cc64">Modified</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1199"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
